page.title: 16Crawford Gala Day.
page.content: The Gala Day started in 1977 to celebrate the Queen's Silver Jubilee, it has been an annual event since then. The Queen and her court are chosen by ballot at Crawford and Daer schools. This year's Queen is Kirsty Gibson, Crawford.The Champion is James Milnes, Crawford.The maids are Susan Thomson and Mary Mair from Daer. Biggar Pipe Band leads the procession on Gala Day.Crawford Majorettes in their blue and white uniforms also take part.Local organisations decorate many colourful floats.This year's floats will include "Little House on the Prairie","Haunted House",Garden Gang"and "The Owl and the Pussycat". It is always a very colourful procession.
